intro: Anthemis corymbulosa, commonly known as the clustered tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in dry, sunny habitats like grasslands and rocky soils.
